heading: Haridwar
overview: Haridwar is an ancient city and important Hindu pilgrimage site in North India’s Uttarakhand state, where the River Ganges exits the Himalayan foothills. The largest of several sacred ghats (bathing steps), Har Ki Pauri hosts a nightly Ganga Aarti (river-worshipping ceremony) in which tiny flickering lamps are floated off the steps. Worshipers fill the city during major festivals including the annual Kanwar Mela

itinerary.day1Overview:
Morning drive to Haridwar, en-route visit Dehradun. On arrival in Haridwar, check-in at the hotel. Explore the spiritual essence of Haridwar, take a dip in the holy Ganges, and witness the famous Ganga Aarti in the evening. Dinner & overnight stay at the hotel.

Haridwar, located in Uttarakhand, is one of the seven holiest places in Hinduism. It is situated on the banks of the Ganges River and is famous for the Ganga Aarti that takes place every evening, attracting pilgrims and tourists alike.

itinerary.day2Heading: Haridwar to Mussoorie: Hill Station Retreat
itinerary.day2Overview: Morning after breakfast, drive to Mussoorie. En-route, visit Kempty Fall and explore Gun Hill, Lal Tibba, Company Garden, and Camel Back in Mussoorie. On arrival, check-in at the hotel. Enjoy the scenic beauty and relax in the serene ambiance. Dinner & overnight stay at the hotel.

itinerary.day3Overview:
Mussoorie – Delhi (Approx. 295 Kms)
After breakfast, drive back to Delhi. Reflect on the memorable moments of your short yet enriching trip to Haridwar and the enchanting hills of Mussoorie.
